hint.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: something that you say or do to suggest something to someone, without telling them directly
hint.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: There have been hints that he may take up coaching.
‘Look, I can’t tell you.’ ‘Oh, come on, give me a hint.’
I made it clear I wasn’t interested in him, but he didn’t take the hint.
Miles had been dropping heavy hints about the cost of petrol.
hint.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: a very small amount or sign of something
hint.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: ‘When?’ he asked with a hint of impatience.
We shall have to turn back if there’s the slightest hint of fog.
hint.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: a useful piece of advice about how to do something
hint.translation[0].definitions[2].examp: helpful hints on looking after houseplants
hint.translation[0].note_box[0].sections: Come on, what is it? Give me a hint.
She was dropping quite a few hints about what she'd like for her birthday.
Mark took the hint and shut up.
I looked hopefully at the cake, but he didn't get the hint.
He had dropped a heavy hint that they might get married.
I'm sick of her subtle hints that I'm not welcome here.
In his article, he gave only vague hints as to what he had actually done.
All right, I can take a hint. I'm leaving.
hint.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: to suggest something in an indirect way, but so that someone can guess your meaning
hint.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: He hinted strongly that he might be prepared to send troops in.
